intro: Cochranea rugosa, commonly known as the rough cochranes, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to harsh, dry conditions. Cochranea rugosa is often cultivated in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
